document_data.name: Broadhand
document_data.text: They have forgotten that a single [[dagger]] at midnight may sow greater terror than 10,000 [[sword]]s at dawn!
document_data.mainbody:
These same heroes arrived at the blacksmith's shop, and convinced him that they were the Banite priests from Nesmé. The relieved blacksmith led the heroes, whom he believed were the messengers, back to the shrine in his hidden back room.

He told the group that the [[Zhentarim]] planned to send armies across the [[Anauroch]] desert, and were close to reclaiming the fallen city of [[Ascore]]. The heroes were also informed that the Zhentarim had allied with the [[Kraken Society]], and there were strange goings-on in [[Llorkh]]. Broadhand believed that the Banites had to act now to stop their historical enemies, and so he sent the adventurers on a quest to meet with the man with the information, Amelior Amanitas.
document_data.Description: The [[Banite]] man wore a metal vest over [[studded leather armor]]. He also wore a green beret, [[gauntlet]]s, and wielded a [[quarterstaff]].
document_data.History:
''Circa'' [[1356 DR]], an acolyte of [[Bane]] reported to Broadhand. The acolyte had managed to intercept a letter written by a [[wizard]], [[Amelior Amanitas]]. The wizard had learned a lot about a [[Zhentarim]] plot from an escaped [[slave]], which of course was of interest to the Banites, who were historical enemies of the Zhentarim.

Broadhand began writing his own letter to the Banite temple in [[Nesmé]] about the new information he had uncovered. However, no messenger replied (as the [[Heroes of Ascore]]-to-be had slain him), and Broadhand became very worried.
